Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Nisin U (natural AMPs; lantibiotic, type 1, class 1 bacteriocin, Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; UCSS1b)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (87.5%) tonisin EActivity: active against S. pyogenes 10 inhibited out of 11 tested; S. uberis 20/26 strains, S. agalactiae 2 inhibited/4 strains, S. dysgalactiae 3/4, S. simulans, S. cohnii, L. lactis 1/3, L. acidophilus 1/1, and S. mitis 2/2.Antivirus: Nisin was found to interact with the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein receptor human ACE2 (Bhattacharya et al., 2021). Est.Jan2024; UPdated 2/2024
Literature Information.Author: Wirawan RE, Klesse NA, Jack RW, Tagg JR.  2006
Literature Information.Title: Molecular and genetic characterization of a novel nisin variant produced by Streptococcus uberis.
